title: example-page
text:
Using _repr_markdown_

class Foo:
    def __init__(self): ...
    def _repr_markdown_(self):
        tbl="""|    | **Type** | **Default** | **Details** |
| -- | -------- | ----------- | ----------- |
| a |  |  | description of param a |
| b | bool | True | description of param b |
| c | str | None |  |
| **Returns** | **int** |  |  |"""
        return tbl


Foo()





Type
Default
Details




a


description of param a


b
bool
True
description of param b


c
str
None



Returns
int

title: nbpages
text:
Display symbol documentation in notebook and website

You can use show_doc to document apis of functions, classes or methods:

def f(x:int=1):
    "func docstring"
    ...

show_doc(f)





f(x: int = 1)

func docstring




class Foo:
    def __init__(d:str,e:int):
        "This is the docstring for the __init__ method"
        ...

show_doc(Foo)





Foo(e: int)

This is the docstring for the init method

title: nbpages
text:
class Foo:
    def __init__(self): ...
    def _repr_markdown_(self):
        return """
## Hello This is a Test Of Markdown Output

Some other stuff here

### If this doesn't appear in the TOC could be a bug.
        """

Foo()


Some other stuff here





You can use lorem ipsum to document apis.

print('hello')

hello

title: example-page
text:
What about Markdown Output ?

class Foo:
    def __init__(self): ...
    def _repr_markdown_(self):
        return """
## Hello This is a Test Of Markdown Output
        """

Foo()

Hello This is a Test Of Markdown Output



class Test:
    def __init__(self):...
    def _repr_markdown_(self):
        return ">      fakemdstring(thisisafake:int, thing:str='foo', totestcsstosee:bool=False, ifitworks:bool=None, anotherarg:int=342, isitgoigntowraparound:bool=True)"

Test()


 fakemdstring(thisisafake:int, thing:str='foo', totestcsstosee:bool=False, ifitworks:bool=None, anotherarg:int=342, isitgoigntowraparound:bool=True)

title: example-page
section: Hello This is a Test Of Markdown Output
text: Hello This is a Test Of Markdown Output
